For math education for high achieving youths
I highly recommend Art of Problem Solving vol. 1 and 2
The AOPS website and foundation have a great community for mathletes
AMC10, AMC12, USAMTS, and AIME are very important to get high school math students involved in
https://artofproblemsolving.com/
Since you're a math teacher
I'd highly recommend getting students to take the AMC10 and AMC12 this upcoming winter 2023 math season
AMC= American Mathematics Competition
AMC10 is for grade 10 and below
AMC12 for grade 12 and below
The American Invitational Mathematics Examination is offered to those who do well on AMC and/or USAMTS (USA math talent search)
And this leads to USA Mathematical Olympiad and then International Math Olympiad for top scorers
https://artofproblemsolving.com/store/list/aops-curriculum
I was obsessed with this stuff from like grade 7/8 through Grade 12
Led me to become an engineer and now a programmer. Like literally life changing

The AOPS online community is like. A peer group of top math students teens trying to out perform each other and also building camaraderie via team contests like ARML American Regions Mathematics League, Mandelbrot
And since you're in NH
Could easily take a team to Harvard MIT Mathematics Tournament (HMMT) for high schoolers
Or HMNT Harvard MIT November Tournament
I think I still have my slide rule that I won as a prize xD
I was on the Phillips Exeter math team with coach Zuming Feng and still have such fond memories of going to Boston/Cambridge for high school math contests on weekends in November and February

The AOPS forums, textbooks, and online classes are so valuable for helping to challenge curious and hardworking high school math students. The MIT application even asks for AMC10/12 and AIME scores I believe, or it did in my day
I can't believe I didn't bring this up earlier
But now that I know a high school math teacher I'd love to pass down my knowledge
And it's important to get students registered for the ~February AMC10/12 a few weeks to months in advance I believe, they need time to mail sealed tests out to schools
